snippet: In four years, the country has gone from the European Union’s worst economic disaster zone to a model of what is being hailed as the healing properties of deep budget cuts.
abstract: Latvia has gone from European Union's worst economic disaster zone to model of what is being hailed as healing properties of deep budget cuts; country's economy has grown about 5 percent in 2012 after bailout and cuts, though deprivation for many citizens persists amid gains; country's turn for better provides rare boost for champions of austerity.
lead_paragraph: In four years, the country has gone from the European Union’s worst economic disaster zone to a model of what is being hailed as the healing properties of deep budget cuts.

headline.main: Used to Hardship, Latvia Accepts Austerity, and Its Pain Eases
headline.print_headline: Used to Hardship, Latvia Accepts Austerity, and Its Pain Eases
